titleStmt.title: George W. Johnston to James F. Robinson
CWG8640

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Louisville Jan 22d 1863.
His Excellency
Gov Jas F. Robinson
Dr Sir

Mrs Kearny was fined in two cases in the city court at the last Term $75. that is $25 in one case & $50 in the other; you have respited the collection for six months & Mrs Kearney has requested me to state to you her character & Standing here, she is a widow & has always been regarded as a civil orderly & well behaved woman, she never was arrested before on any charge nor for any Misdemeanor, & I presume she is wholy unable to pay the fines; I have no reccollection that he Husband was ever arrested or charged with any violation of the Penal Laws

Very respectfully your
obt Servt
Geo. W. Johnston
(over)
The Draftsman of the Petition made a mistake in stating that the fine was $75 in Each case It was that amount in the two cases. $25 in one case & $50 in the other case.
I do not recollect that Mrs Kearny was Ever fined for any violation of the law before the time herein mentioned
